FeedItems.Title: NuGet Spring 2019 Roadmap
FeedItems.Summary: We published our last NuGet roadmap in June last year. Many of the features announced were major additions to NuGet and we have been hard at work to implement those over the last few months. In this...

FeedItems.Title: Enable repeatable package restores using a lock file
FeedItems.Summary: With PackageReference, NuGet always tries to produce the same closure of package dependencies if the input package reference list has not changed. However, there are a few scenarios where it may not...

FeedItems.Title: Lock down your dependencies using configurable trust policies
FeedItems.Summary: For the past several months we have focused on various features to improve package security and trust. Around a year back, we had announced our plans on various signing functionalities that we have...

FeedItems.Title: Improved package debugging experience with the NuGet.org symbol server
FeedItems.Summary: Starting today, you can publish symbol packages to the NuGet.org symbol server. With NuGet.org as a single service provider for libraries and symbols, package authors and consumers will have a...

FeedItems.Title: Introducing Source Code Link for NuGet packages
FeedItems.Summary: NuGet.org now supports surfacing source code repository link for NuGet packages. This will enable package authors to surface both the project’s website and the source repository using the...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org starts repo-signing packages
FeedItems.Summary: In May, we implemented Stage 1 and enabled support for any NuGet.org user to submit signed packages to NuGet.org. Today, we are announcing Stage 2 of our NuGet package signing journey – tamper...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet Summer 2018 Roadmap
FeedItems.Summary: This blog post provides insights into the NuGet team plans for the upcoming quarter (July – Sep 2018). In the March 2018 NuGet Spring 2018 Roadmap, we had outlined Package Signing,...

FeedItems.Title: Introducing signed package submissions to NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary: In September 2017, we announced our plans to improve the security of the NuGet ecosystem by introducing the ability for package authors to sign packages. Today, we want to announce support for any...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org will only support MSA/AAD starting June 1st, 2018
FeedItems.Summary: We had previously announced the deprecation of NuGet.org’s home-grown authentication in favor of Microsoft accounts (MSA) that will allow us to add support for additional security systems such...

FeedItems.Title: Welcoming SymbolSource to the .NET Foundation
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to welcome SymbolSource.org to the .NET Foundation! SymbolSource has been providing a valuable service to the .NET Community for years with the ability to host Symbols for public NuGet...

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[GitHub Usage] Filter checked out files by blob size" (#7339) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Define a limit for the config files that will be checkout and set it in the background Job

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Azure Search] Respond to preview feedback" (#6979) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[Azure Search] Monitor search index lag" (#7226) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is meant to replace the /search/diag commit timestamp monitoring. Once idea is to sort index by commit timestamp and get the latest value. 

Two things to do in parallel
- [x] Query on commit timstamp. this has a gap for PackageDelete catalog leaves since no document in the index will have a record of this leaf, but this is probably okay.
- [x] Reach out the Azure search team about monitoring ingestion lag

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Deleting a user does not remove their ownership from package registrations without packages" (#7197) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
When deleting a package, if you choose to hard-delete the package, you are given an option to either remove the registration (if the registration has no other versions) or leave it.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18014088/58665337-7b580b00-82e5-11e9-8c91-14cf6a2d18cb.png)

If you leave the registration and then delete the user, the user will still own the registration, even though the user has `IsDeleted` true.

Events.RelatedBody: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7326#discussion_r301925255

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Move more services to Library And enable real deletes" (#7338) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Moves more of the implementations of required services into NuGetGallery.Services library.
Updates AccountDeleter to consume these changes.

Merge changes and test fixes coming soon.

Please look at changes by commit to make this more managable. Thanks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Figure out automatic secret rotation for Azure Search Service" (#7337) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The Azure Search web app can live indefinitely and secrets are cached for process lifetime.

How do we get new secrets picked up without redeployment?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[GitHub Usage] Update Gallery to use updated GitHub Usage blob" (#7213) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: This should be done after https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7212

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[GitHub Usage] Make feature public" (#7336) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Make sure Anand and Kaitlin are okay with it, then make it public!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[GitHub Usage] Author the blog post" (#7335) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Author the blog post with Loïc and Anand.
- Tweet
  - Announce it
  - Ask for feedback
- Blog post
  - How the job works
  - Why we made this (what's the customer win?)
  - Ask for feedback
  - How can you run it yourself (link to a Readme.md?)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[GitHub Usage] Find all popular C# GitHub projects" (#7207) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Use GitHub search APIs to find popular C# projects. Add this to the job

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[2019.07.10][ReleasePrep] RI dev into master" (#7331) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Azure Search] Figure out how to properly boost packages that just match on tag" (#7334) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Dapper matches "ORM" tag but is currently not getting a boost from that so it appears very low in results.

Some communities have centered around a specific tag, e.g. `tags:"aws-sdk-v3"`. These cases should work well too.

It may work okay right now with field scoping to tags, but for example "tags:orm" is still not perfect.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Investigate and improve and/or problem in matching" (#7333) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Right now if multiple terms in a search query match, the "boost" doesn't seem very extreme as if it is as relevant as only one term matching.

Azure Search people can help here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Get rid of freshness in scoring profile until we do more analysis" (#7332) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[Test Failure] Same error dialog “Unable to parse config file” will prompt twice" (#8320) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Release-5.2.x\5.2.0.6090
VS Version: D16.2\29110.123
OS: Windows 10 RS4_Release 17134.1.180410-1804
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. Create a solution with at least 1 project (e.g. 3 WPF projects) and close the solution.
2. And create a NuGet.Config file having some parsing errors next to the sln file.
3. Reload the solution.
## Expected
The error dialog “Unable to parse config file” will prompt only once.
## Actual
Same error dialog “Unable to parse config file” will prompt twice.
![ErrorDialogPromptTwice](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/61047802-dddb1580-a412-11e9-86f0-070fd553d8c9.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable SHA tracking and enforcement for Packages.Config scenarios" (#7281) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We'd like to enable Packages.Config scenarios to track and enforce SHA.

For PackageReference users, project lock file will enable SHA enforcement. 
We are exploring either:
1) adding SHA as a new Attribute of the Package element in Packages.Config
2) adding lock file to Packages.Config scenarios.

@zivkan

spec: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Packages.config-SHA-Validation

Tasks:
- [x] Create/update lock file on package install and uninstall #7951 
- [x] Update lock file on restore when lock file out-of-sync with project #8035
- [x] Validate SHA on restore #8036
- [x] Add nuget.exe command line parameters for lock file features #8038

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NU1201 Project is not compatible with netcoreapp2.2 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v2.2). Project supports: net462 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.6.2)" (#8318) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a ASP.NET Core 2.2 project that references a .NET Framework 4.6.12 class library. This worked without any issue until I migrated the class library to PackageReference and started to get that error.

It was my understanding that a netcore 2.2 project (net standard 2.0) could reference a .NET framwork 4.6.2 (net standard 2.0) without issue and this was the case when using package.config. 

Is this intended? Why?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove net472 support from assemblies that don't require it - netstandard is enough" (#8323) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We multi target net472, netstandard2.0 throughout our solution, since we work in both dotnet and VS. 

net472 implements netstandard2.0 however, so netstandard willl be compatible everywhere net472 is.

The only trick is we can't do this wherever we are doing framework specific things. 

The benefit of this will be smaller packages/faster build times/faster test runs.

//cc @zivkan @rrelyea 

Probably not a good idea to until @heng-liu's extra tfm work in is in, because there might be overlaps.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Nugetizer3000 includes reference-only content in package" (#8322) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
dotnet + NuGet.Build.Packaging

NuGet.Build.Packaging - 0.2.3

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):
2.2.107

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a netstandard2.0 class library, use following project file:
```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>netstandard2.0</TargetFramework>
    <GeneratePackageOnBuild>true</GeneratePackageOnBuild>
    <PackageId>n3000</PackageId>
    <Description>n3000 test nuget package</Description>
    <RestoreSources>$(RestoreSources);https://ci.appveyor.com/nuget/nugetizer3000</RestoreSources>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="NuGet.Build.Packaging" Version="0.2.3" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

2.  dotnet build

Expect: package with only lib
Actual: package contains all netstandard reference only libraries.

Bug is here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Build.Packaging/blob/abbff50b9b64d708945a726405e70351035cadb5/src/Build/NuGet.Build.Packaging.Tasks/NuGet.Build.Packaging.Inference.targets#L186-L190

This shouldn't be packing referencepath, but instead something like ReferenceCopyLocalPaths.
